message: The Center for Sustainable Landscapes (CSL) is an integral part of the Phipps visitor experience as a "living museum" and focusing attention on the important intersection between the built and natural environments.
title: Welcome

message: The CSL generates almost all of its energy from solar panels. Energy is stored for the winter when there is less sunlight, and the building's efficient energy usage is minimized through passive design strageties.
title: Solar Energy

widgets.title: Energy Cost Fun Fact
widgets.label: energy_cost_fun_fact
widgets.template:
Did you know?

The CSL uses as little as 20% of its expected energy usage (compared to traditional buildings). That's more than a $50,000 difference every year!

message: The elevation of the CSL above Panther Hollow promotes favorable conditions for wind generation. This excess generated energy helps serves upper campus electricity needs and contribute to our net zero energy approach.
title: Wind Energy

message: The CSL is net zero water, managing all rainfall and treating all sanitary waste on site. Up to 60,000 gallons of rainwater can be harvested and stored in a underground rain tank. It can later be used for toilet flushing, as well as interior irrigation and maintenance.
title: Water Usage
